The International Olive Oil Council classifies olive oil into two main categories and five levels: virgin olive oil (Virgin Olive Oil) and refined olive oil (Lampante Olive Oil or Refined Olive Oil).
The initial squeezing of olive oil, also known as extra virgin olive oil, is obtained by mechanically cold pressing and filtering fresh olive fruits to remove impurities.
Based on the degree of acidity, it can be divided into three levels:
Extra Virgin Olive Oil (Special Grade): It is the highest grade and has the highest quality of olive oil, and it is a purely natural product.
The flavor is excellent, with a delicate and pleasant plant fragrance, and an acidity level not exceeding 1%.
Fine Virgin Olive Oil: with slightly higher acidity, but not exceeding 2%, and a pure, fragrant taste.
Ordinary Virgin Olive Oil: It has an acceptable taste and aroma, with free fatty acidity not exceeding 3.3%.
Refined olive oil refers to olive oil obtained by refining unrefined olive oil with an acidity of over 3.3%, which may also be called "secondary oil."
Refined olive oil can be divided into two grades:
Extra Virgin Olive Oil: A blend of refined and cold-pressed extra virgin olive oil, adjusted for flavor and color, with acidity below 1.5%, and a clear, pale golden yellow color.
Refined Olive-Pomace Oil: Also known as olive pomace oil, it is obtained by extracting oil from olive pulp using a solvent-based process and then refined.
If you have gone through the classification of oils, you should have already discovered that the acidity is a very important indicator for olive oil.
It's worth knowing that, much like grapes used in winemaking, olives from different regions and varieties of olive produce olive oils of different quality standards.
The optimal growth region for olive trees is:
The Mediterranean coast has the most suitable soil and climate conditions for olive growth, including temperature, sunlight, air humidity, and rainfall.
Except for the Mediterranean coast, other regions can only sparsely plant in suitable growth areas.
Main production areas (Mediterranean):

Italy, Spain, Greece, Turkey, Portugal, Morocco, Syria, Israel, Tunisia, Algeria, Egypt, Pakistan, Lebanon, and many others share a similar climate with countries farther south, such as Argentina, Peru, and South Africa.
The olive harvesting month(s): (This is a fragment sentence, so a complete sentence would be: "The olive harvesting month(s) are from September to November.")

Every year, from March to June, is the time for olive trees to bloom and bear fruit. From July to October, the fruit begins to mature and ripen. The fruit transitions in color from green to red, purple, and finally turns black.
The month of November to the following February is the harvest season (the freshness of olive oil is very important, you know).

The nutritional components of olive oil are:

1. Monounsaturated fatty acids (mainly oleic acid)
2. Vitamin E
3. Vitamin K
4. Polyphenols (such as oleuropein, hydroxytyrosol, and tyrosol)
5. Squalene
6. Iron
7. Sodium
8. Calcium
9. Potassium
10
Olive oil is rich in unsaturated fatty acids, including oleic acid, linoleic acid, and linolenic acid, as well as vitamins A, B, D, E, K, and antioxidants.
Olive oil is considered to be the most suitable oil for human nutrition among all oils discovered so far.
The Democratic Summit has concluded, Biden declares that the fire of freedom will never be extinguished.

The online "Summit for Democracy," called for by President Biden of the United States and attended by leaders of governments from 110 countries as well as heads of civil society and private sector organizations, concluded on Friday, December 10.
In his closing remarks, Biden said, "The fire of freedom burns in the heart of every person in the world, and authoritarian regimes will never be able to extinguish it."
He also stated that plans are underway to hold the second annual global "Summit for Democracy" next year.
Taiwanese government representative and Executive Council member Tang Fuang and Hong Kong pro-democracy activist Nathan Law also spoke at the summit on the second day.
Biden said, "We know the task in front of us is incredibly daunting."
But we also know that we can welcome challenges, because, as this summit has shown, the democratic world is everywhere.
"The flame of freedom cannot be extinguished by an authoritarian regime; it burns in the hearts of people all over the world."
Biden also stated that defending democracy requires the collective effort of society as a whole.

He said, "As leaders of the government, we have a responsibility to listen to our citizens, strengthen the safeguards of democracy, promote reform, achieve transparent and accountable governance, and better withstand the power of buffering and impact from authoritarianism, as well as those who want to blatantly pursue power over public interest."
"Democratic Summit" Day Two's themes are Defending Human Rights, Consolidating Democracy and Countering Authoritarianism, and Combating Digital Authoritarianism and Affirming Democratic Values.

This day happens to be "Human Rights Day." (December 10th)

Note: "International Human Rights Day" is celebrated annually on December 10th to commemorate the adoption of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights by the United Nations General Assembly in 1948.
UN Secretary-General Guterres stated in his opening remarks that democracy faces challenges globally, particularly those brought about by emerging digital technologies.
He said, "It's time to reaffirm our shared values and stance, as well as our democratic resilience."

This requires deepening societal dialogue, addressing inequality issues, combating corruption, updating social contracts, investing in high-quality education, and expanding opportunities for women and girls.
"We must also resolutely condemn all forms of populism, localism, and extremism, including those that exploit tools provided by the technological revolution."

Hong Kong democracy and human rights activist Nathan Law delivered a pre-recorded video speech at the summit, reminding attendees to continue to pay attention to the human rights situation in Hong Kong and among Uyghurs and Tibetans and other Chinese ethnic minorities.
He said: "For a long time, the world has been benefiting from China's rise, yet no mechanism has been established to hold it accountable."
That is why political figures and civic society leaders must cooperate.
"We must utilize all the resources we have to ensure that the revival of democracy is our top priority."
Rao Guancong also calls on the free world to unite and confront the threat of the Chinese Communist Party.

He said, "Perhaps some of you are afraid of angering Secretary General Xi Jinping, perhaps some of you do not want to lose the Chinese market, and perhaps some of you have not yet realized the threat that the Chinese Communist Party poses to our democratic values."
And that is the reason for our failure.
"This is also a reason why we must change."

During the roundtable discussion on "Combating Digital Authoritarianism and Upholding Democratic Values," Taiwan's Executive Yuan Secretary-General Tang Feng delivered a "National Statement" via video, emphasizing that Taiwan stands on the front line of combating authoritarianism and dictatorship.
He also shared his experiences on combating the COVID-19 pandemic through information transparency and building mutual trust.

He said, "At a time when democracy is still in its infancy in Taiwan, we have consistently stood at the forefront of the global fight against authoritarianism, and have even taken on a leadership role in promoting global freedom, democracy, and human rights."

During the epidemic, authoritarian governments in various regions have rationalized human rights abuses in the name of public health and collective interests, presenting global democracy with signs of regression.
However, in Taiwan, we don't need to implement a lockdown to control the epidemic, nor do we need to ban/remove information to defeat misinformation.

On the second day of the "Democracy Summit" schedule, the U.S. Department of the Treasury announced that it had imposed sanctions on 15 individuals and 10 entities from several countries, including China and North Korea, that have been identified as severely violating human rights. Additionally, investment restrictions were imposed on a Chinese company that has been identified as assisting in human rights abuses through the use of surveillance technology.

Jiangxi to Train 10,000 Rural Primary School Music and Art Teachers within Three Years - Xinhua News

Xinhua News Agency, Nanchang, May 22 (Reporter Chen Yu Shan): Reporter learned recently from the Jiangxi Provincial Department of Education that to strengthen the ability to ensure the team of teachers in shortage subjects and achieve balanced development of compulsory education in rural areas, since 2016, Jiangxi Province has planned to train one qualified music, art, and physical education teacher for each primary school in rural towns (and below)

According to what I understand, the training targets teachers who are 45 years old or younger, from primary schools in rural areas throughout Jiangxi province, who have a basic knowledge or talent in music, art, or physical education, and are capable of teaching related courses in addition to their main subject.

Through training, enable them to grasp the basic knowledge and teaching skills in the aesthetics of phonetics education, update their teaching ideas and concepts, master modern teaching methods, improve their subject teaching ability, activity design ability, campus culture ability, and self-development ability, and construct a versatile team of phonetics aesthetics teachers, alleviating the problem of lack of phonetics aesthetics teachers in rural areas.

To ensure training quality and effectiveness, Jiangxi has planned to train one music, art, and physical education teacher from each of the province's 100 counties (cities, districts), totaling 300 trainees. The training will enhance their teaching demonstration and leadership abilities, curriculum design and organization abilities, training abilities, and online workshop development abilities, serving a role in teaching, demonstrating, guiding, and supervising.

Actually, there are many details to consider when it comes to fashion coordination for girls who are slightly overweight.
A physically heavyset girl should wear a skirt that is neither too short nor too long, with a length that reaches the knees and is just long enough to cover the thickest part of the thighs.
If a skirt is too short, it will reveal the fat on your legs.

If it's too long, it gives the impression of being short and plump.

(Note: This sentence is likely referring to an object or piece of clothing that is too small or ill-fitting, giving the appearance of the opposite problem.)

If you divide your outfit into an upper, middle, and lower third with different colors, such as your top, skirt, and long socks, it will create the illusion of being taller and give off a slender appearance.

Many dark-colored clothes are actually a staple for plus-size women (the author can relate to this), and dark colors are also a good way to hide a heavier body. A high-class and elegant black short skirt is also a top choice for slim plus-size women.
Wearing dark-colored clothing, especially a black skirt, will make you appear slimmer.
If you have thick thighs, make sure your socks and shoes are not too eye-catching.
The more widespread something becomes, the better it is for it not to be too gaudily colored.
To avoid drawing attention to your legs and feet that gives people a fat appearance.

Here are some fashion tips for slightly overweight girls:

1. Wear clothes that fit well and flatter your figure. Avoid anything too tight or too loose.
2. Choose darker colors, such as black, navy, or dark gray, as they are slimming.
3. Opt for clothes with vertical lines or patterns, as they can make you look taller and slimmer.
4. Avoid horizontal stripes, as they can make you look wider.

"A slightly overweight girl should never wear tight-fitting short skirts, and her top should not be too short or tucked into her skirt, as this can make people feel uncomfortable when looking at her. If she has thick legs, she should wear black thigh-high socks or fishnet stockings (the kind with small grid patterns, of course). She should choose a flowy, floral skirt with a soft material, and pair it with a loose, open-neck top
Of course, even a slightly plump girl needs to be careful when wearing short skirts.
A chubby girl wearing a short skirt should choose a top in the same color, as this will create an illusion of added height to her fuller figure.
Wearing a short skirt with high heels can make your legs appear longer, which is the hottest trend for summer!
If you are top-heavy but have slim legs, I recommend choosing an elegant-style dress with a short skirt.
It not only hides your belly, but also showcases your strengths.
A-line skirts can help you look slimmer, making them a great choice for curvy girls. To enhance this effect, choose a fitted top to create a layered look and appear even slimmer.
Pair a simple white T-shirt with a short skirt, even BBW can try.
A slightly overweight girl can also dress in a fashionable way.
If overweight girls can master the rules of dressing and coordinating outfits, they will also become the center of attention.
After making changes in fashion coordination, you should also exercise more in your daily life and strive to shed the "slightly overweight woman" label earlier! 😄

"The girl is acting as a target for her sister's archery practice, thinking that at least it's better than being hurt emotionally." - Xinhua News Agency
A girl is standing in front of a large wooden board in Hangzhou Wulin Square, with the words "Human Target, 10 yuan per arrow" written on it.
Yesterday morning, a photo of a girl from Hangzhou willingly serving as a "human dartboard" to help her sister raise funds went viral on social media.

A photograph shows a girl standing in front of a large wooden board that is slightly taller than her in Hangzhou's WuLin Square. The wooden board has the words "Human Target, 10 yuan per arrow" written on it, indicating to passersby that they can shoot arrows at it after paying.
This behavior sparked heated discussions among netizens.

Yesterday, the Publicity Department Chief of Hangzhou Public Security Bureau's Downtown Branch confirmed to a Beijing News reporter that the police have confirmed that the girl took such drastic action after being urged by her sister to fundraise. However, this kind of behavior is not worth promoting. After being warned, the girl left the local police station yesterday.
The female teenager who was soliciting donations by setting up a "bullseye" on the street was warned.

A picture circulating online shows a long-haired girl posed in the shape of the Chinese character "人" (ren, meaning "person") in front of a large wooden board. The board has the words "Human Target, 10 yuan per arrow" written on it in black ink. Another wooden board in front of her displays her bank account number and WeChat and Alipay account information.
The image sparked controversy after being posted online.
Some netizens believe this action is a "publicity-seeking begging behavior," while many others have expressed sympathy for it.
We discovered the situation around the square when we were patrolling around 10 am on the 23rd. At that time, the crowd of onlookers had already grown quite large.

When interviewed by local media, police officers from Tianshui Police Station near the scene stated that the two girls who were selling items were both around 20 years old and dressed in a vibrant and attractive manner.

Among them, the girl who served as the "human target" kept crying, pleading with passersby to play this game; another girl standing nearby was calling out and saying that her friend's sister had leukemia and needed surgery fees urgently, asking for everyone's help.
We have contacted the local Guizhou police and learned that the girl was raising funds for her sister's leukemia treatment.

Yesterday, the propaganda officer of the Wenzheng Branch of Hangzhou Public Security Bureau told a reporter from Beijing News that the girl's name is Ji Jiali, and she was fundraising for her sister Ji Jiayan.
However, because treatment would still require over 300,000 yuan, and no good solution for fundraising came to mind at the moment, this behavior was carried out.

He said that throughout the process, one girl served as the target, while the other was responsible for assisting but did not participate. The entire time, no one was seen shooting an arrow, only people watching and taking pictures which were then posted on Weibo.
After the public security bureau's examination, the bow and arrows used do not fall under the controlled category.
The person in charge stated, "We do not endorse or advocate for this fundraising method that seeks to attract attention."
After being warned by the police officer from the local police station, she had already left the police station.

Jiexin Advocates Rational Consumption to Consumers Before "Double Twelve" - Economic Observation Network - Professional Financial News Website
This year, the total value of online payment transactions during the "Double Eleven" shopping festival reached 1.77 trillion yuan, setting a new record compared to previous years.

The profusion of fashionable discounted red packets has once again captivated consumers, leading them to exclaim in delight. This consumption frenzy, on the one hand, leaves one in awe of the growing consumption power of the population, and on the other hand, forces one to calm down and ponder the impact of consumerism on society and today's mainstream consumer groups.

On the eve of "Double Twelve," Jiexin Consumer Finance Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Jiexin") issued a call for rational consumption, reminding the majority of users, especially young people, to establish a good consumer mindset and habits, and to reject blind and excessive consumption.

According to the "Consumer Financial Literacy Survey Analysis Report" released by the People's Bank of China this year, the national consumer financial literacy index is 66.81, which is 2.04 points higher than in 2019.

Overall, the financial consumption behavior of residents in our country is generally good, but there are significant differences in financial behavior and skills, and there is still a need to further improve the basic level of financial knowledge.

The financial literacy level of the elderly and teenagers is relatively low, with the "elderly and teenagers" remaining the continued focus of financial education; Nielsen's "Report on the Debt Status of Chinese Young People" and CCTV Finance's "2019-2020 Report on the Consumption of Chinese Young People" show that the younger generation has enormous consumption potential, with credit consumption becoming an important means of consumption upgrades.

As a licensed consumer finance institution, Jiexin has always been committed to promoting a happy life for the general public through high-quality and caring services, advocating for consumers to develop good and correct consumption attitudes, and actively responding to regulatory calls to enhance the rational consumption consciousness of consumers, especially the young generation, through concrete actions.

In the past several years, Jiexin has consistently carried out comprehensive and diversified financial literacy activities targeting young people, including college students. Through cooperation with top domestic universities, we have subtly guided the consumption needs of young groups through innovative practice competitions and other forms, helping them establish rational consumption concepts and plan their consumption needs, thereby supporting their accumulation of life wealth.

As the December 12th shopping festival approaches, Jiexin reminds all consumer friends to establish a rational consumption mindset and correct money view, resist impulsive and excessive consumption, and avoid the pitfalls of consumer loans to prevent affecting personal credit and future economic life.
When consuming, it's essential to plan ahead and use your strength wisely to make payments on time.
If payment is overdue, the overdue record will be recorded in the personal credit report, which may negatively impact future car purchases, home purchases, and other economic activities.

At the same time, when enjoying financial products and services, it is also important to choose reputable institutions and channels, and to verify whether the relevant institutions have the necessary business licenses.

Futurely, Jiexin will continue to provide consumers with demand-matching and diversified services through its mature and reliable consumer finance system and continually updated financial products, constantly empowering the general public to improve their financial literacy levels, and helping consumers cultivate the concepts of rational consumption and moderate borrowing, becoming a lifelong trusted consumer finance partner.

Vietnam People's Army Website - Gulf Cooperation Council Should Address Common Challenges
The stopping places of Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman include Oman, the United Arab Emirates (UAE), Qatar, Bahrain, and Kuwait.

It is worth noting that this marks the first visit of Muhammad bin Salman, Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia, to Qatar since the Saudi-led Arab coalition imposed a boycott on Qatar in mid-2017, leading to the Gulf diplomatic crisis.

In this crisis, Saudi Arabia, the UAE, Bahrain, and Egypt have severed diplomatic relations with Qatar and imposed a comprehensive boycott, accusing Qatar of supporting terror organizations and having close ties with Iran.
The tense foreign relations have seriously affected the internal unity of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, and have had a negative impact on the economy of the countries in the region.
Four Arab countries have blocked land, sea, and air routes to Qatar.

This crisis was resolved only at the Gulf Cooperation Council summit in January 2021, where all Gulf countries signed a agreement brokered by the United States and Qatar, stepping towards "unity and stability."
Saudi Arabia has reopened its border with Qatar.
Saudi Arabia and Egypt are making efforts to restore their relations with Qatar by appointing new ambassadors to the country.

The resolution of the Gulf Arab countries' disagreements with Qatar, in order to restore their relations, comes from the necessity to unite for the benefit of each country and regional stability to address common challenges.
During the Saudi Crown Prince's visit to Oman, the two sides agreed to open the first direct land route between the Gulf countries, which is the first of its kind between the two nations.
The construction of a 725-kilometer-long channel connecting the two countries will provide convenient conditions for the travel and supply chain integration of their citizens.
The Public Investment Fund (PIF) of Saudi Arabia will invest $50 billion in Oman, and companies from the two countries have signed 13 cooperation memorandums of understanding worth $300 billion.

Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia's visit to Gulf countries coincides with Iran's negotiations with major world powers to salvage the Iran nuclear agreement, also known as the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA), which Gulf countries have criticized for failing to address the issue of Iranian missiles.
Countries in the Gulf region have consistently regarded Iran as a long-term "competitor" and view its nuclear program as a threat to regional security.
Each Gulf country believes that failing to address the issue of Iran's missiles and not taking action to curb Iran's activities in the region is flawed.
In the context of unsuccessful nuclear negotiations between Iran and several major countries that did not meet the desires of the Gulf countries, Saudi Arabia and Iran held direct talks.
Their goal is to curb the escalation of tensions in that region.
This is one of the factors that mitigate the economic growth of the Gulf Cooperation Council countries.
The upcoming GCC summit will be the first meeting of GCC countries since some member states resolved their dispute with Qatar.

This is an opportunity for the Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation (BIMSTEC) to reevaluate its foreign policy achievements to promote the recovery and unity of the BIMSTEC and make contributions. At the same time, various measures are proposed to ensure full cooperation among its member states to address common challenges and contribute to the stability and development of the Bay of Bengal countries.

Resonate the University Spirit with the Spirit of the Times - Xinhua Net

The so-called university spirit refers to a series of educational philosophies and value pursuits that have been developed and accumulated by a university over its long history of development, which constitutes the soul of the university.

From ancient times to the present, the spirit of the university has been of crucial importance to the development of politics, economics, culture, technology, and society, as well as the progress of a nation.

From the birth of the world's first modern university, universities have shouldered a unique mission distinct from other social organizations. For universities in China, which arose during a time of national peril, their spirit has been deeply influenced by traditional culture and historical changes, advocating for the values of "illuminating virtue to benefit the world and cultivating order to bring peace," as well as a patriotic commitment to "strengthening the nation through education."

Currently, the trends of digitalization and internationalization in higher education are increasingly prominent. The global competition in education, technology, and talent is becoming more and more intense. Higher education, as an important "supply-side" factor, is facing unprecedented opportunities and challenges in its structural reform.

In particular, the proposal of the "Overall Plan for the Coordinated Development of First-Class Universities and Disciplines" has demonstrated China's confidence and determination in advancing from a nation of higher education to a strong nation of higher education, and has put forward even higher and more stringent requirements for the development of universities.
How to rapidly advance to the top tier of the world, quickly build several world-class universities and a number of world-class disciplines, and achieve "leapfrogging" despite existing gaps?

In addition to having confidence in our goals, path, and abilities, universities should fully leverage the following three advantages: first, the late-mover advantage, by continuously attracting outstanding academic talents from overseas, learning and borrowing from the advanced experiences of the world's top universities, and achieving significant improvement in academic level and educational quality; second, cultural advantages, by inheriting the wisdom accumulated by Chinese civilization over 5,000 years, promoting and developing excellent traditional culture,

It is especially important to realize that it is impossible to build top-tier universities by cloning the same model across all schools. Instead, each institution should play to its strengths, while also showcasing its unique personality and characteristics.
The characteristics of running a school should reflect both the common Chinese characteristics and each institution's unique positioning, educational traditions, and resource endowments.

When it comes to Zhejiang University, we focus on highlighting three aspects in our education: first, we emphasize the cultivation of innovative and entrepreneurial talents, building an integrated environment for the fusion of science and education and school-enterprise cooperation, forming a complete entrepreneurship education ecosystem; second, we emphasize the convergence of academic disciplines, promoting the optimization and adjustment of the disciplinary system, creating an institutional environment for interdisciplinary studies, and actively cultiv
During this process, it is most important to consistently uphold the spirit of the university and ensure that the spirit of the university resonates with the spirit of the times.

For Zhejiang University, the motto "Strive for Innovation," the shared values of "Diligent study, Moral cultivation, Rigorous reasoning, and Sincerity," and the guiding principles of "Embracing the vastness of the Yangtze River and the ocean, Clarifying truth and promoting virtue, Developing resources and benefiting the people, and Cultivating oneself and building the nation" collectively constitute the latest

This is the crucial guarantee for the school's persistent pursuit of the correct approach to running the school, continuously accumulating cultural heritage and concentrating spiritual strength, with rich connotations and far-reaching significance.

Among them, "Holding in the Yellow and the Xiang" emphasizes an open and inclusive spirit, reflected in the aspiration to "make use of talents from all over the world," embodied in the adoption of high-quality educational concepts from renowned universities worldwide. "Seeking truth and cultivating virtue" emphasizes a spirit of truth-seeking and moral integrity, indicating that universities should not only pursue truth but also receive moral cultivation and character refinement. "In
This series of spiritual ideals and value pursuits represents the very soul of Zhejiang University's 120 years of education.
"The wise listen to the unspoken, the intelligent see that which is not yet shaped."

Chinese universities should further establish themselves in the overall cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics, deeply understand the historical mission and position in time of higher education, and accelerate the construction of world-class universities.

At the same time, uphold humanity, impartiality, and independence, allowing the spirit of the university to clash and interact with the spirit of the times and the national spirit, thereby providing an inexhaustible driving force for realizing national strength and national rejuvenation, and achieving the common ideals of humanity.

The longest limit for Guangxi university students to take a leave of absence for entrepreneurship is 5 years - Xinhua News Agency

Xinhua News Agency, Nanning, May 19th (Reporter Zhang Ying) Reporters recently learned from the Education Department of the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region that in the future, all universities in Guangxi will implement flexible schooling, relax the limit on the number of years that college students can take a leave of absence, and the leave of absence for college students to start their own businesses can be extended by 2 to 5

To promote the ability of college students to innovate and start their own businesses, the education, human resources, and other departments in Guangxi have jointly built an entrepreneurship platform, constructed more off-campus practical teaching bases, science and technology parks, student entrepreneurship parks, and entrepreneurship incubation bases, providing external support for college students' entrepreneurship.

According to the requirements, by 2020, the innovation and entrepreneurship practice bases of each higher education institution must reach an area of 3,000 square meters or more for undergraduate schools and 2,000 square meters or more for higher vocational schools.

The government encourages universities to establish credit for innovation and entrepreneurship, and gives priority support to students who excel in innovation and entrepreneurship practice to change their majors.
College teachers should engage in industry-based job placement for at least two months every two years to enhance their awareness and abilities in innovation and entrepreneurship education.

The Education Department of the Autonomous Region has required all higher education institutions in Guangxi to thoroughly implement the University Student Innovation and Entrepreneurship Training Program, striving to ensure that every university student participates in at least one innovation and entrepreneurship training program during their time in school.
Colleges and universities should actively organize students to participate in various levels and types of innovation and entrepreneurship competitions, and provide financial support.

At the same time, Ouyang Yu expressed his sincere blessings to the graduates and parents, and extended his deep respect to the university's faculty and staff who

At a lecture at the Australian College of Arts and Humanities, Professor Sun Yifeng of the institution praised Professor Liu Zunyi as a globally renowned economist, known for his outstanding scholarly achievements and forward-thinking educational philosophy.
Besides his achievements in economic development, economic growth, and leadership in the East Asian economy, he is also a far-sighted educational leader.

Professor Nakamura's invention not only fundamentally changed the lighting industry but also drove the widespread application of white light-emitting diodes (LEDs) in everyday life and industrial production, making a tremendous contribution to human welfare.

At a reading of Dr. Li Lan-Juan's tribute, Sun Yi-Feng stated that as a pioneer of China's artificial liver technology, Dr. Li created a unique and effective Li-Shi Artificial Liver System, achieving a major breakthrough in the treatment of severe hepatitis and liver failure, and significantly reducing the mortality rate of liver failure.

In the fight against the COVID-19 epidemic, her "four antagonizing two balancing" plan, along with the artificial liver, microecological, and stem cell technologies brought by her team, significantly increased the critical care treatment success rate.

At the recital of Dr. Li Xiaoling's tribute, Sun Yifeng stated that Dr. Li Xiaoling established the foundation for innovative research in operations management, shaped the way people think about supply chain theory and practice, and fundamentally changed business models around the world.
Li Xiaoliang gained fame for popularizing the concept of the "long whip effect" in operations research management and explored measures to address this phenomenon.

As a highly accomplished inventor, Ms. Jiang often has the ability to simplify complex technology and theories, making them accessible to the general public.
Finally, Dr. Chen Kai took the stage as the representative of honorary doctors to read the thank you speech.

He is very pleased to see that Macao and the Greater Bay Area have established a good example in the medical industry: from the establishment of the first Chinese medicine quality research national key laboratory in Macau, to the booming development of traditional Chinese medicine in the Greater Bay Area, Macau has played a huge role in integrating top talent in the traditional Chinese medicine field in the region.

Furthermore, he believes that Australia's management team possesses foresight and vision, not only providing academic research opportunities for students but also supplying the society with many responsible talents.
He is very honored to have the opportunity to communicate and cooperate with Australia, and sincerely congratulates Australia on its achievements in recent years.

Have you encountered any continuing education credit hours issues when registering for first-level cost estimation?

For those who fail to register on time, if they do not provide proof of having completed continuing education totaling at least 30 study hours in the past year, they will need to provide proof of having completed a total of at least 120 study hours of continuing education in the past four years, including proof of having completed at least 30 study hours of continuing education for each completed year, in order to reregister.
Continuing education fees for cost engineers.

When registering for online continuing education, cost estimator engineers are required to pay a tuition fee to the relevant management authorities. The standard fee for the 30-hour compulsory course is generally 300 yuan/person per year (including the uniform teaching materials).
The cost of a 30-hour elective course is 300 yuan/person per year.
The cost for a mandatory course of 30 instructional hours and an elective course of 30 instructional hours, including the uniform textbook for continuing education, is 600 yuan per person per year.

(1) Participation in continuing education for registered cost engineers organized by the China Pricing Association or provincial-level and departmental management agencies is calculated based on the recorded time of online learning courseware.

(2) Participation in centralized, instructor-led training programs or various types of training classes and seminars organized by the Chinese Institute of Cost Engineering or provincial-level and departmental management authorities can be recognized as 4 hours of continuing education credit per half day.

(3) Teaching continuing education courses for members of the Chinese Mid-Price Committee, provincial-level and departmental cost engineers and cost technicians, with each half-day session equivalent to 10 hours of study.
(4) Participation in Zhongjia Xiehe Provincial Subject Research, Industry Standard Formulation, and Textbook Writing, with 30 credits recognized per item per year.

(6) Participation in the compilation of national qualification examination materials for registered cost engineers and in exam question drafting, review, and grading is recognized as 30 continuing education hours per year.
(7) Personally signed and publicly published (using official journal numbers as the standard) engineering cost-related professional papers or works.
A published work of 10,000 characters is considered equivalent to 12 hours of study.

For every 1000 characters published in a national journal, 8 credits are recognized; for every 1000 characters published in a provincial journal, 5 credits are recognized; for every 1000 characters published in a municipal journal, 3 credits are recognized.

(9) Construction cost consulting companies that are organized by construction price supervision and inspection organizations, provincial-level departments, and provincial-level construction cost associations that have been approved or authorized by the China's Ministry of Commerce can provide public training to society (excluding general management and skill training for enterprises). Each half-day training can be recognized as 4 training hours, with a maximum of 30 training hours recognized per year.
Cost Engineer's Online Continuing Education Learning Process

Once the registration institution receives the fee, the student's identity is immediately activated, and a construction engineer can directly enter the network education classroom to learn using their username and password.
Students learn through watching recorded courseware, asking and answering questions, and participating in online discussions.

If you forget your password and are unable to log in due to an incorrect username or password, please contact the registration organization to which you belong. They can assist in changing your password (but not your username), so that you can use your newly modified password to log in again.

Asian American groups complain of discriminatory admissions practices at Ivy League schools like Yale - Xinhua News

Note: Xinhua News is a state-owned news agency in China, so it is a reliable source for news coming out of China.

Xinhua News Agency, Washington, May 23 (Reporter Xu Jianme) More than 130 Asian American groups submitted a complaint to the US Department of Education and the Department of Justice on the 23rd, protesting against Yale University, Brown University, and Dartmouth College for discriminating against Asian American applicants in the admissions process.
The Asian Education Alliance, which initiated the appeal, held a press conference in Washington, D.C., on that day.

The chairman of the organization, Zhao Yu Kong, stated at the press conference that over the past 10 years, the number of Asian applicants who meet the admission requirements of American elite colleges has doubled. However, the percentage of Asian students in these three American elite colleges has remained basically the same.
Many studies indicate that these universities, during their so-called "holistic" admissions process, have been "long-term, consistently, and systematically discriminating against Asian applicants."

Zhao Xu Kong introduced that a study by Sanders et al. in 2014 showed that, relative to the number of applicants, Asians have the lowest acceptance rate among all racial groups in these three colleges.

Data from the US Department of Education shows that among all Ivy League schools, Brown University and Dartmouth College have the lowest acceptance rates for Asian American students, and Yale University and Brown University have effectively implemented racial quotas for Asian American applicants for over 20 years.

Zhao Kuang told Xinhua News Agency reporters that they hope to submit an appeal, and expect the US Department of Education and Department of Justice to launch an investigation and take measures to prevent these universities from continuing to discriminate against Asian Americans in the admissions process after determining the facts.
They also hope that high schools will actively address this issue by changing their recruitment policies toward Asian applicants after receiving complaints.
So far, the three colleges that have been complained about have not yet responded.

The Asian American Education Alliance was established in 2015, at which time it filed a complaint alleging discriminatory admissions practices at Harvard University, but the US Department of Education did not accept it for review due to procedural reasons.
In addition to the Chinese American group participating in this appeal, it also includes Indian American, Korean American, Japanese American, and Pakistani American education organizations.

In September 2020, Mr. Lu learned about a factory building located in Zhejiang Yuyao Zhangting Town from a real estate agent. After multiple on-site visits, Mr. Lu decided to purchase the factory building.

In December of the same year, Mr. Lu negotiated the details of purchasing a factory building with the family member of the property owner, Mr. Lin, and transferred 200,000 yuan as earnest money through a bank transfer on the same day.

Lin (surname) signed on the "Deposit Receipt for Factory Building Sale" as the payee, which states, "If the buyer does not wish to purchase this factory building, the deposit shall be returned to the seller. If the seller is not willing to sell this factory building, the deposit will be doubled and returned to the seller. The two parties agree to sign the factory building sales contract within a week."

However, later on, the two parties were unable to reach a consistent opinion on the main contract terms such as the sales scope of the factory and the payment method, which caused the real estate sales contract to be delayed and not signed.
Considering that both parties were unable to reach an agreement on the contract content, a few days later, Lin returned the 200,000 yuan earnest money to Mr. Lu.

After finally deciding on a house, having paid the deposit and prepared the remaining sum, all that was left was for Mr. Lu to "take one final step" and sign the contract, but the seller refused to sell, leaving Mr. Lu feeling helpless and angry.
Therefore, Mr. Lu sued Lin to the People's Court of Yuyao City.

After trial, the court finds that the parties were unable to sign a formal contract, and this cannot be solely attributed to the defendant. It is reasonably assumed that negotiations were unsuccessful. Therefore, the case should not apply the penalty for earnest money, and the defendant is not required to bear the liability of returning double the earnest money as a breach of contract.
After the first-instance verdict, the plaintiff appealed.
Recently, the higher court upheld the original verdict.
"Attorneys remind that due diligence and careful attention are necessary obligations in the transaction process."

When signing a contract, as the buyer, you should fulfill your due diligence obligations, such as verifying the information of the property's owner, checking whether the property is occupied by others, and other relevant information. Additionally, clearly specify the exact time and location of delivery in the contract to prevent disputes from arising during the performance of the contract.

(From Deutsche Welle Chinese) "The foreign ministry spokesperson of China stated on Saturday (December 11) after the end of the 'Summit for Democracy' that the US hosting a 'Leaders Summit for Democracy' is 'drawing a line based on ideology, weaponizing and instrumentalizing democracy, engaging in anti-democratic actions under the guise of democracy, inciting division and confrontation, and shifting domestic contradictions'."

The Chinese government believes that "for a long time, the United States has been imposing its political system and value principles on others and implementing 'democratic transformation,' excessively using unilateral sanctions, and instigating 'color revolutions,' resulting in disastrous consequences."
"Democracy" has long been used as a pretext for America's interference with other countries' "weapons of mass destruction."
This summit is an action taken by Biden to fulfill his campaign promise.
The two-day meeting will be held via video conference, with leaders from 111 countries invited, including the leader of Taiwan, but China and Russia did not receive invitations.
On the eve of the summit, China and Russia criticized the United States over democracy issues within the U.S., stating that the U.S. has no qualification to host such a summit.

However, there have been skeptical voices both internationally and within the United States. For instance, critics have questioned the intention behind inviting leaders with authoritarian and democratic backsliding tendencies, such as those from the Philippines, Poland, and Brazil, leading some to suspect that the Biden administration's true motive for organizing this summit is not to promote democracy but to serve geopolitical purposes.
The newly appointed German Chancellor Scholz also attended the Video Democracy Summit.

"The Chinese Foreign Ministry's statement on Saturday stated that 'Today, the American-style democratic malady is on full display, with problems such as money politics, identity politics, partisan polarization, political extremism, social division, racial strife, and wealth disparity becoming increasingly severe.' The United States' democracy is built upon a capitalist foundation, a 'rich person's game.'"

"As the leader of the government, it is our responsibility to listen to our citizens, strengthen the safeguards of democracy, promote reform, achieve transparent and accountable governance, and resist the power of buffering and impact from authoritarianism, as well as those who blatantly pursue power over public interest," said President Biden in his speech.
He emphasized that democracy is not self-evident, "we must continually update it within each generation, and in my view, this is the defining challenge of our time."
Biden also said that "at a time when global democracy and human rights are facing continuous and worrying challenges, democracy needs warriors to defend it."

The U.S. side has pledged that, following this Democratic Summit, they will launch a year-long initiative that includes a $4.244 billion proposal to strengthen democracy worldwide and provide support for independent news media.
The United States hopes that countries will make specific public commitments to improve their democratic systems before the Summit for Democracy, scheduled for the end of 2022.
"Let us all implement our commitments and report on our progress next year," said Biden.

Education Thoughts: How to Let "Straight-A Students" and "Poor Students" Each Get Their Due in College Exams-Xinhua Net

Three students from Lanzhou University of Transport wrote a letter to the university leaders, expressing their confusion about the college exams and proposing to increase the exam difficulty, change the exam format, and make the exam truly reflect the students' actual level.
Indeed, college exams have long been a "hot topic" for discussion.
In university campuses, students come from all over the country with varying abilities and differing levels of study, resulting in a wide range of learning situations.
Conducting an assessment on such a diverse group of people is unavoidably met with different reactions.
Of course, if the exam questions are all of the same type, have a high repetition rate, and are overly simple, they will undoubtedly create a completely different impression.
A student who doesn't study hard may be able to pass by cramming before the exam, and they might even achieve "half work, double result" if they try other methods.

Therefore, a "useless student" can pass and even score high without putting in any effort, while a "straight-A student" who never skips class, always does well on homework and notes, and studies hard for exams doesn't score significantly higher - this is a strange situation.

Therefore, it seems that the issues reflected by the students of Lanzhou Jiaotong University in college exams are not unfounded, and I believe this situation is not only present at Lanzhou Jiaotong University.
From this perspective, we should applaud the three students who bravely spoke their minds in writing.

Indeed, it is not uncommon for those who have attended college to engage in cramming for exams, trying various methods to "extract" exam questions from teachers, striving to define the scope of the exam, and seeking "intensive guidance" before the exam. In fact, instances of students bringing cheat sheets to exams or seeking teachers' leniency after the exam are not unheard of.

In the author's opinion, as a teaching quality assessment orientation, evaluating whether a university's exam is passing or failing depends more on the teacher's comprehensive grasp of teaching and learning, as well as the scientific formulation of questions based on this foundation.
Entering the undergraduate stage, majors begin to split off, and many major courses focus on foundational knowledge.
There is no doubt that mastering the basic knowledge points of a subject is what college exams test.
"The knowledge learned in college is mostly foundational theory and basic knowledge, and in terms of specific knowledge points, the room for change is not large and is generally fixed."
"Just as a teacher says, 'The basic knowledge of college math you learned 20 years ago is still what you should focus on studying now.'"
Knowing that the knowledge points remain basically unchanged does not mean that the types of exam questions are singular or that the questions are repeated.

At many universities, exams are typically organized by a team responsible for creating questions, with senior teachers in the subject overseeing the compilation of the exam paper. Exam grading is also participated in by all teachers responsible for the subject, which helps to prevent the repetition of questions to a certain extent.

However, a set of test questions that align with the reality of education and study must be formulated. The topics should be based on the overall learning situation of the students, with difficulty distributed in a normal distribution. Additionally, it is necessary to comprehensively grasp the teaching situation, conduct a thorough analysis of the students' learning level, and dynamically control the difficulty and type of questions in the examination setting. This will not only highlight the assessment of basic knowledge but also consider the assessment of abilities,

"Exams are the conductor's baton of university education. The type of exams determines the students' corresponding study plans, and this will ultimately impact the effectiveness of university education."
Regarding the suggestion letter for students, the Lanzhou University authorities attach great importance to it and have deployed a rectification plan across the entire university.

It is required that each teaching department organizes teachers to conduct study sessions and course-ending exam comparative self-inspections, formulate exam question drafting and related regulations, and at the same time strengthen the supervision and inspection of exam question drafting and review links, refine the grading system, and strengthen the comprehensive inspection of each stage of course teaching.

Addressing the issue of uniform test types and repeated questions in college exams requires the implementation of appropriate policies. However, the key lies in the daily operations, where teachers need to have a comprehensive understanding of the teaching situation. This requires not only a deep understanding of the teaching content but also a deep understanding of the students' learning situation. By thoroughly understanding both aspects, teaching and learning can better connect, forming a positive cycle, and exams will better reflect reality, allowing "academic stars

Sabah has 3,200 newborn students without birth certificates due to a shortage of special anti-counterfeit paper.

(Kota Kinabalu, 11th October) The Sabah National Registration Department announced that due to the depletion of specialized security paper stocks, they have been unable to issue birth records to newborns since early October, with the total number of affected individuals now reaching 3,200.

However, the department head, Keramidas, has guaranteed that the records of all infants who have applied for birth certificates are in the system, and they will be reissued once the security paper arrives next week.
At a press conference, he addressed the reports by an online media outlet regarding the issue of printing problems with the Sabah Daily lasting for ten months and offered an explanation.
He said that the issue had appeared two months ago and that Zalaer (a place name) was also facing the same problem.
"One of the reasons is that the Chinese manufacturers of customized anti-counterfeit paper have been affected by the epidemic, resulting in delayed delivery to our country."
He explained that the security paper used for the Sabah newspaper is different from that in other regions, so it cannot use the inventory from other state-owned entities.
Carrumus has revealed that the latest batch of anti-counterfeit paper arrived in Kuala Lumpur on June 6 and will be handed over to the printing company on June 8 to carry out partial printing work.

"The department will send someone to Kuala Lumpur next Thursday to pick up the goods and immediately proceed to the final stage of printing upon return to Sabah, with an estimated additional 2 working days (December 20) before it can be handed over to the applicant."
We will notify the applicants to go to the local branch offices to collect the application forms.
He added that, to date this year, Sabah has issued a total of 24,801 birth certificates.

Education News: Beijing Reduces Special Talent Admission Ratio for Junior High Schools in 2016 - Xinhua News Agency
On December 21 and 22, the entrance examination for middle school specialized talent students in Beijing will be jointly organized and implemented by the education committees of each district.
This year, all districts in Beijing have reduced the admission ratio for gifted students, making the competition even more fierce.

For the example of Dongcheng District, this year the ratio of primary school students in the district who are admitted to middle school based on their special talents should not exceed 5% of the total number of students admitted in the district, which is planned to be 380 people. The actual number of students who attend the school should not exceed 10% of the school's admission plan.
Only students who possess athletic, artistic, or technical talents and have signed up online are eligible to participate in the gifted and talented student admission examination.

To conveniently allow students to attend nearby examinations, Dongcheng District is continuing the examination arrangement method from last year, setting up 1-2 examination locations in each school district, totaling 13 examination locations.

Testing locations are divided by examination zone, with time segments divided by the hour. Students being examined will enter the examination point within different examination zones according to their assigned time slots for the day's examination.
On May 23, the list of students who passed the education recruitment examination was published online by the District Education Admission Examination Center. Students can check their results online.

"24-hour nucleic acid test results required, establishment of 'buffer zones' - State Council's Joint Prevention and Control Mechanism requires strengthening epidemic prevention and control in border cities" - Xinhua Net.

Xinhua News Agency, Beijing, December 11 (Reporters Dong Rui Feng, Gu Tian Cheng) - The State Council's Joint Prevention and Control Mechanism has recently issued a notice on strengthening epidemic prevention and control work of new coronavirus pneumonia in border city areas. It requires that individuals who have left border city areas (excluding those connected to Hong Kong and Macao) in the recent period must hold a negative
Based on the notification, the required time frame is from the day each provincial-level region determines and announces the scope of border cities, until March 15, 2022.
Furthermore, the notice proposes that, under certain conditions, port cities can study the establishment of epidemic prevention buffer zones within their jurisdictions.

A spokesperson from the National Health Commission's Disease Prevention and Control Bureau introduced that for some border cities, cross-border trade is their main economic pillar, and there is frequent movement of people between the two sides of the border.

Implementing a zoning and differentiated management policy, we will change from one barrier control line to two, making it possible to advance the chokepoints and compress the risk of epidemic spillover, achieving the maximum effectiveness of epidemic prevention with the minimum societal impact and the lowest societal cost.
Recently, several local clustered epidemic situations have occurred in our country, all of which are caused by the import of overseas epidemics through border city ports.

The aforementioned notice reveals several issues, including untimely monitoring and warning of local epidemic situations, inadequate closed-loop management of high-risk position personnel, perfunctory regular nucleic acid testing, incomplete disinfection of cold chain items at each stage, unsanitary management of centralized isolation sites, and insufficiently scientific and precise emergency response to the epidemic.

Notification Requests: Focus efforts on improving the mechanism for epidemic prevention and control in border cities, strengthening the monitoring and early warning system for epidemics, implementing border control measures in nine areas, quickly filling in the gaps and addressing weak links in border city control, maintaining a high level of alertness, and scientifically and precisely carrying out prevention work to create a tight and solid defense against imported cases.

The notice emphasizes that all border cities must synchronize the research and deployment of epidemic prevention and control with livelihood protection work, publicize and ensure the smooth operation of lifeline hotlines, regularly inspect potential hidden dangers in the supply and pricing of basic living materials, and promptly address and proactively respond to prominent issues reflected by the public.

Based on the notification, the designated border cities include counties (cities, districts, banners) where open land, water, and air ports are located, as well as the cities, leagues, and autonomous prefectures where they are located. The specific scope will be determined by each province (autonomous region, directly governed city) based on the needs of epidemic prevention and control and promptly announced.

I happened to come across the following article, which discusses from a business perspective and the preservation period perspective why a customer wants a logistics company inside a bonded zone to handle canning, even though canning is considered deep processing and does not fall within the scope of the operations of bonded logistics companies. The following text might help explain why the customer wants to do this.
I have visited many infant formula manufacturers and have come into contact with many production lines for infant formula.
Actually, the ingredients for boxed and canned formula milk are identical, with no differences at all.
So, everyone will certainly ask: why does the shelf life of bagged products be one year, while that of canned products is two years or longer?
Or they might ask: why is the price difference between packaged and bagged so big?
Actually, many consumers, or "mom-level" ones, believe that the reason for this is that the materials are different, which results in a significant improvement in quality.
Actually, the raw materials are the same; it's just that people think that the more expensive ones are better.
Some consumers, after eating it, still claim that the taste or flavor just feels different, as if they're just pretending to like it!
Let me first explain to everyone the reason why hearing aids are valuable and where their value lies.
Why are the price differences so huge when their raw materials are the same?

"Because when manufacturers set prices, most of them take into consideration that if the bagged price is too high, consumers will have a hard time accepting it. This means that the profit generated by the manufacturer will be low or even non-existent. So how can a manufacturer survive without profit?"
Therefore, they have seen a significant increase in the pricing of their disguised products to ensure their profit margin.
Therefore, most manufacturers recommend headphone (listen-style) packaging, rather than bagged packaging.
And you still wonder where the thousands of dollars or even billions of advertising fees that manufacturers pay each year come from?
Everyone can imagine/figure it out.
As society develops, marketing costs, such as sales staff in shopping malls, display fees for shopping malls, product giveaway fees, and advertising fees, are continually increasing.
So, each manufacturer is continuously rolling out new products that cater to popular demand, and their prices are steadily increasing, which is a result of rising market costs for new products.
The main objective is to obtain higher profits; in fact, the increase in the cost of their raw materials will not exceed 3 or 4 dollars at most.
Some brands, in order to promote their products, resort to all means and collude with hospital doctors, who assist in the product's promotion and receive a commission of 30 to 80 yuan per item sold.
Chinese law strictly prohibits such methods of operation, as this practice actually deceives consumers.

It is recommended that people buy bagged powdered milk and transfer it into a can, provided that they have a can at home. This can help save costs and increase the freshness and seal of the powdered milk, with no negative effects on children.

And remember, don't assume that the shelf life of a canned product is longer than that of a bagged one. After opening, the shelf life of both canned and bagged products is the same, it's just that bagged products are harder to keep fresh and more prone to spoilage due to moisture.

Don't scare people away before the starting line - Xinhua News Agency.
When browsing the book market, one often can feel the popularity of self-help books about success.
Many success books nowadays advocate for "the best principle" - that is, they first assume or imply that you can "do it," and then tell you what exactly you need to do.
Essentially, we've skipped over the most important and fundamental part, which is "how to achieve" it.

Therefore, these books all share a common characteristic—they either put in their best effort and finish the task completely, or they don't do anything at all; they either give it their all or nothing; they either climb Mount Tai or simply stay put where they are.
This "best principle" will make anyone who sees it admit that it is "absolutely correct," but 99% of people will be intimidated before they even start.
Because this theory advocates for a "you must firmly decide to completely change yourself and make a 180-degree turnaround" path, which happens to be many people's fatal weakness.
To those who strictly follow rules, cling to the old ways, and resist change, shouting in their ear "you need to change" is undoubtedly self-deception and akin to playing a Xiangqi piece on a cow.

Most people are hesitant and hesitant to make a "change" due to fear, and find it hard to make up their minds. Alternatively, they may make a hasty decision to change due to a momentary impulse, bravely take the first step, but often the good times are short-lived, and they can't keep it up for long, and sustained change is rarely seen.
The famous "From Tomorrow On" crosstalk segment by Mr. Ma Sanli perfectly and classically exemplifies this "universal human nature."

The biggest problem with the "highest principle" is that the threshold is too high, which often exceeds the limit of ordinary people's abilities, causing the vast majority of people to "admire it from afar."
"The 'Next Best Principle' might be a possible path for more ordinary people to achieve relative success."

The core of the "second best principle" lies in "lowering the threshold" - it encourages a "turning small victories into great victories" theory, that is, if you can't do 100, doing 1 is also fine: because 1 is always greater than 0; if you can't climb Mount Tai, climbing the small sand dune in front of your house is also fine, because that is still better than standing still.
In any case, doing something is always better than doing nothing.

Because the threshold has been significantly lowered, this has created more possibilities for ordinary people to achieve persistence, and with persistence, the probability of success will also increase.
The path to success by only following the "second best principle" is just a bit longer, that's all.

In summary, while the "best principle" may appear to promote success for all on the surface, it ultimately motivates only a few. On the other hand, the "second-best principle" is effective in motivating a larger number of people and benefiting as many as possible.

Qinghai Lake's naked carp resources' stockpile increases by 71,000 tons this year - Xinhua News Agency

Xinhua News Agency, Xining, December 11 (Reporters Liu Xiaofei and Zhang Hongxiang) According to the latest monitoring results obtained by reporters from the Qinghua Provincial Department of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, the naked carp resource reserves in Qinghai Lake have increased by 0.71 million tons compared to last year, reaching 10.85 million tons. This is an increase of over

The common name for the naked carp in Qinghai Lake is "Huang fish," which is a precious fish species unique to Qinghai Lake. It plays a crucial role in maintaining the ecological safety and biodiversity of the "water-fish-bird" chain in the Qinghai Lake region.

In the 1960s and 1970s, the naked carp population in Qinghai Lake was significantly reduced due to large-scale hunting and deteriorating breeding environments, with the resource volume of naked carp in Qinghai Lake being only 2592 tons in 2002.
In 2004, the naked carp in Qinghai Lake was listed as an endangered species in the "China Species Red List."

Starting from 2003, Qinghai Province has implemented a fishing ban in Lake Qinghai, prohibiting any units, organizations, and individuals from fishing or catching naked carp in Lake Qinghai and its main rivers and tributaries, and prohibiting the sale of naked carp and its products.

At the same time, by implementing artificial breeding and release, cleaning the main tributaries that flow into Qinghai Lake, and designing scientific and reasonable "fish passages," the stock of naked carp in Qinghai Lake will continue to increase year by year.

Vice Director Yang of the Qinghai Provincial Department of Agriculture and Rural Affairs introduced that as of now, a total of approximately 180 million naked carp have been artificially bred and released into Qinghai Lake, contributing to the recovery of Qinghai Lake naked carp resources by more than 23%.

Is the tingling sensation in the foot bath tub due to a short circuit?
Choosing a suitable foot bath tub can achieve very good foot care and health benefits. Today, the Gome editorial team will provide an answer to this question, hoping to be of help to our friends.

As people's awareness of health care has strengthened, foot spa tubs have become increasingly popular among consumers. A wide variety of products with different price ranges, from over a hundred yuan to thousands of yuan, have emerged in the market, giving consumers a vast selection space.

On the relevant data surface, compared to traditional home appliances, sales of healthcare appliances such as foot bath tubs are booming, but there are no specific industry standards for foot bath tubs, which means there is a certain level of safety hazards.
"Soaking your feet in charged water is really dangerous, right?"
Mr. Li told reporters that recently, he bought a foot bath tub as a birthday gift for his father, but his father felt his soles becoming numb when soaking his feet.

Mr. Li initially thought that the tingling sensation in his father's feet was caused by the vibration function of the foot bath, but to his surprise, even after turning off the vibration function, his father still felt a numbness at the soles of his feet.
Mr. Li tried the electric pen, and to his surprise, the pen turned out to be electric. He discovered that the foot bath tub's water was conductive.
Later, he contacted the business, and the merchant's attitude was still not bad, but despite getting a refund for the foot bath, Mr. Li still felt unsatisfied.

Because he discovered that there are no clear and detailed industry regulations regarding the highest temperature setting, suitable user groups, or harmless materials for the already popular foot bath tub.

Under normal circumstances, a foot bath tub is not likely to have an electrical issue, but it cannot be ruled out that a small number of products may not have been strictly inspected during manufacturing.
Therefore, choose a split-type foot bath tub when purchasing.
Separation of water and electricity poses no safety hazards.
At the same time, you can also freely use an electric pen to test (it).

Metaphysics refers to the study of questions that cannot be directly answered through sensory perception, using rational reasoning and logic.
Metaphysics is the fundamental law of philosophy, aiming to explain the basic nature of existence and the world.

The Chinese term "Xing Er Shang Xue" (形而上学) is translated from the phrase "the philosophy of formless and nameless" (形而上者谓之道，形而下者谓之器) in the "Xi Ci Shang" (系辞上传) chapter of the "I Ching" (易经). It was translated into English as "metaphysics" by the Japanese scholar J
The branch of Metaphysics includes Ontology, Natural Theology and its related issues.
Entity theory refers to "studying which nouns represent real existing entities and which nouns only represent a kind of concept."
Metaphysical naturalism, which denies the existence of God.
The theoretical foundation of this view holds that all phenomena can be explained by natural reasons, a concept put forward by philosophers who support science and the theory of evolution.
The method of methodological naturalism refers to a research approach that makes no mention of God.
"Philosophy of mind is the philosophical branch that studies the nature of consciousness and its relationship with the body, particularly the brain."
Binary theory and monistic theory are the two major schools of thought regarding the "relation between the mind and the body."
"Epistemology is a philosophical branch that explores the nature, origin, and scope of knowledge."

Ethics is the academic discipline that involves systematic thinking and study of human moral life; in this context, ethics is defined as the set of behavioral principles recognized by a group of people or a culture.

Mainly divided into Meta-ethics (abstractly studying ethical theories or critiques of their essence) and Normative Ethics (evaluating various different moral views and providing moral principles for correct or incorrect behavior).

It studies what kind of ethical behavior guidelines people should follow, applies ethics theory to practical living conditions (including bioethics, political ethics, etc.), and describes ethics (collects information about how people live and summarizes it based on observed patterns).

Its ethical scrutiny does not begin with preconceived theories, but rather investigates the actual moral agents and their real choices observed, promoting all moral factors of such decisions. It explores the ethical views held by social groups.
The history of ethics includes Greek and Roman ethics, as well as medieval Christian ethics.
Part One: Humanist Ethical Thought, Represented by Rousseau and Montaigne.
Part Two: The Ethical Thought of Religious Reform, Represented by Calvin.
Part Three: Political Ethics, represented by Machiavelli and others,
Logic is a discipline that studies the principles and standards of valid inference and proof.
Logic typically consists of three parts: induction, abduction, and deduction, and can be divided into formal logic and informal logic.
Aesthetics is a discipline that focuses on the study of the nature and significance of beauty.

Ding Zi Lin: To a Friend.

I would like to sincerely thank all of my friends for your humanitarian assistance to our family in the long period of over 30 years since our tragedy, especially your uninterrupted aid since I made a personal appeal for humanitarian assistance to my friends both domestically and internationally in early 1994.
Now, most of the victims' parents have passed away, and the orphans have grown up and started their own families and careers.
Your act of kindness helped us disadvantaged families get through our most difficult time.
Currently, the COVID-19 pandemic is wreaking havoc globally, with most donors now being retirees.
Therefore, I urgently request that you stop giving humanitarian donations to the Tiananmen Mother group, as this humanitarian aid activity should have ended perfectly a long time ago.
I will forever engrave your kindness in my heart and firmly believe that your noble deeds will be etched in history.
Due to various reasons, I can only express my intention in this way, so please understand, friends!
Accept my sincere blessings.

Ceramic Yang: Please allow me to take this opportunity to introduce the 32-year history of humanitarian aid efforts by the International Foundation for China's Development (IFCSS) and the Minnesota China Democratic Foundation (MCDF).
In the process of engaging in humanitarian rescue efforts, the
(Apple Daily photo: The Tiananmen Mother's website is managed by Tao Jiu.)
Relief funds often fail to reach the needy hands of those affected by the Tiananmen incident.
In 1994, at the suggestion of Teacher Ding, the "Tiananmen Mothers" established a special group to oversee and manage the receipt and distribution of humanitarian assistance funds.

In 1998, MCDF established the "June 4th Orphan Education Fund," which was executed for 11 years until 2009, when all of the June 4th orphans had graduated from university. Subsequently, MCDF established the "June 4th Needy Older Adults Emergency Assistance Fund" and has continued to execute it to the present day.

The funding for these projects mainly comes from university and societal donations from the year of Tiananmen Square incident, personal generous donations, and support from the Democracy Fund of Brother Universities.
Since 2018, I have received support from the Prisoner Reentry Research and Training Foundation.
It wasn't until last year, 31 years later, that the June Fourth victims finally received a portion of the donations raised in Hong Kong in the name of June Fourth.
During that time, "China Human Rights" also independently implemented their humanitarian aid projects.

We understand that Mr. Ding called for a halt to donations for June Fourth, which he did out of consideration for the donors. We are all retired seniors, and our income is not as abundant as it was before our retirement. Therefore, we would like to express our gratitude to Mr. Ding's "letter to friends" for this matter.
We will respect the decision of those who find it difficult, and will terminate this project within two years, and will restart as needed.
To those who have generously opened their hearts and bravely taken risks to deliver humanitarian aid for many years, I express my gratitude and respect.
