If you're planning to enter this industry, it might be a good idea to find a place to train, but if you don't have that intention, self-study is better. After all, training can be quite expensive and requires six months of your time to learn.
If you plan to enter this industry, training is indeed a very good choice, especially for those who have weak self-discipline, as training is an excellent choice for them.
If one has relatively strong self-discipline, they can choose to self-study, but it will be more tiring.
Of course, choosing a good training institution is a very important matter.

Firstly, the strength of the faculty is crucial when evaluating a training institution. If the faculty is not strong, the training institution has no significance. Of course, the faculty strength of many newly established training institutions is not particularly impressive.

Before choosing a training institution, it's better to investigate the institution first and find out about the students it has produced. After all, only the institution's students truly know what the institution is like and whether its courses are good or not.

Hello, the truth is I don't know how to answer your question, because you haven't provided sufficient background about your own situation, and learning this thing is highly dependent on one's personal circumstances.
For example, your profession, age, desired language to learn, and even the city you are in, all have connections to what you are studying or the industry you want to enter.

If you are a student who has not yet graduated, or if you have already graduated from a computer-related major, then in terms of efficiency and cost, I personally recommend self-study as it is the most economical option. While there are many excellent offline and online training institutions available, they can be quite expensive and require a significant time investment, typically requiring concentrated training for 3-6 months.

However, if it's the situations I mentioned, self-study is very convenient. There are many free learning resources available on the internet now, or you can find plenty of training resources on Bilibili. If you can't find resources, you can also contact me through my introduction to get free resources or detailed consultation.
Additionally, there are some classic books that can be studied in conjunction with videos for a more comprehensive learning experience.

If you are not a computer science major but are willing to invest some learning expenses and time, it is recommended that you learn at a training institution. This way, the learning process will not be too difficult, the teachers explain things in detail, and there are people who can specifically answer your questions. Additionally, the institution can assist with learning planning and supervision.

Moreover, many training institutions now sign employment agreements, offering internal referral quotas. After learning, they recommend you to companies, which can save you a lot of trouble in the interview process when looking for a job.

That's it for my views mentioned above. I only gave a general overview before since I didn't know your situation, and it wasn't very detailed. If you have anything else you'd like to inquire about, feel free to contact me for further communication.

This biennale is jointly curated by the Diriyah Biennale Foundation of Saudi Arabia and the UCCA Center for Contemporary Art in China, with Tina Fengyi Fu, Director of UCCA Center for Contemporary Art, serving as the Artistic Director.

According to the curatorial team, the theme of this biennale is "Crossing the River by Feeling the Stones," metaphorically representing the reform strategies adopted during the period of social and economic transformation, as well as reflecting the current situation of Saudi society and cultural development.

This biennial exhibition spans nearly 12,000 square meters and is spread across six interconnected buildings, showcased in six units: "Crossing the River by Feeling the Stones," "Inheritance as Experiment," "Marginal Thinking," "Towards the Public," "A Beautiful New World," and "On the Spirit of Art."

Of the total number of works in this exhibition, artwork from 27 Saudi artists accounts for over forty percent, encompassing various forms such as painting, installation art, and performance art; 12 Chinese artists' works also received significant attention, with some artists creatively using recycled materials in their creations, such as Xu Bing in "The Endless Landscape Series: Backstory" (2014), where he reconstructed a classic landscape painting using disc

Dillierah Biennale Foundation CEO Barkley stated that they hope this session of the Biennale can establish international dialogue, allowing global audiences to understand the burgeoning cultural industry and creative community in Saudi Arabia, and strengthen interactions.

Feiyu Tian said: "The goal of the biennale is twofold, to allow Saudi contemporary art to participate in global dialogues and to help Saudi audiences immerse themselves in the contemporary art world."

According to reports, a series of lectures will be held during the biennial opening period, featuring artists, curators, and opinion leaders from the creative industry who will discuss topics such as cross-cultural communication and contemporary art development.

Yunnan: Coordinating and Regulating the Management of Rural Public Welfare Positions - Xinhua News Agency

Xinhua News Agency, Kunming, December 12th: To continue to do a good job in helping the impoverished population with employment and to consolidate and expand the achievements of poverty alleviation, Yunnan Province recently issued policies to promote the management of rural public-interest positions, which will help to fully promote rural revitalization.

The person in charge of Yunnan Provincial Department of Human Resources and Social Security introduced that currently, Yunnan has developed 44.83 million rural public-interest positions to provide employment for labor forces from impoverished families and other disadvantaged groups in rural areas. These positions play a crucial role in helping impoverished groups achieve employment and income growth, consolidating the achievements of poverty alleviation, and effectively enhancing the ability of various public services in rural areas

This new rule was jointly issued by the Yunnan Human Resources and Social Security Department, the Rural Revitalization Department, the Finance Department, and other six departments, and mainly standardizes the scope of recruitment for grassroots public welfare positions, financial management, position development, and position management.

In terms of position development settings, the new rules clearly specify that they should be set according to the principles of "post-based allocation, person-based positioning, dynamic management, and overall control" as well as the principles of "who develops, who uses, who is responsible," "one person, one post, voluntary publicity, and unified management."
The recruitment process must be carried out in the following steps: announcement, declaration, audit, public notice, hiring, pre-job training, and arranging for taking up the post.

Furthermore, the new regulations specifically outline the responsibilities of the main departments in charge of developing rural public-interest positions, the subsidy standards and methods for rural public-interest positions, and require that each department in charge of developing rural public-interest positions purchase commercial accident insurance for the personnel placed in these positions. The regulations also mandate that relevant departments regularly supervise the payment of subsidies for rural public-interest positions.

When most people believe that Intel's recent action will have a certain impact on TSMC, and it is quite likely to snatch TSMC's "bread and butter."

The reason for being so confident is that Intel, as a long-standing tech titan in the US, has been deeply rooted in the semiconductor field for several decades, possessing a large talent pool and technical reserves, and will surely rapidly rise to victory in the short term, defeating TSMC.
However, Intel's decision was dismissed contemptuously by TSMC founder Morris Chang.

At the "2021 Master's Think Tank Forum" held in April this year, Zhang Zhongmou made a shocking statement regarding Intel's decision to invest in building a wafer fabrication plant. Zhang Zhongmou spoke bluntly without hesitation: "Intel building a chip-making foundry is quite ironic."

Zhāng Zhōngmóu's dismissive attitude towards Intel's entry into the foundry sector stems from his lingering resentment towards TSMC (Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company) and Intel's past feud, which occurred over 30 years ago.

In the sixties and seventies of the last century, Intel was the jewel of American manufacturing, occupying the peak position in the global market, and was the overlord in the field of global semiconductors.
In the 1980s, the high-end semiconductor chips of the world were monopolized by a few powerful entities.

At that time, the semiconductor industry was characterized by the IDM (Integrated Device Manufacturer) model, where a single factory completed the design, manufacturing, and final testing of chips. Intel was a representative of that era.
However, such a pattern is too burdensome for some small businesses, and many semiconductor entrepreneurs can only step back in the face of enormous factory construction costs.

Inspired by market demand, the chip industry began to see phenomena of division of labor and cooperation starting in the 1980s. In 1984, Zhang Zhongmou heard that there were companies specializing in chip design, and he thought that if there were companies specializing in design, then there could be a factory specializing in wafer manufacturing established.
Soon afterward, Zhang Zhongmou's plan became a reality, and TSMC was established.
TSMC has focused its core business on the "wafer fabrication" segment, providing foundry services without design.
At that time, TSMC (Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company), which had just been established, was a mere minnow in front of the Intel behemoth.

In order to obtain capital support, Zhang Zhongmou once sought investment from Intel, but when Intel heard that TSMC only focused on the manufacturing segment of the chip industry, they clearly considered themselves superior and looked down on TSMC, and thus flatly rejected investing in TSMC.
Zhang Zhongmou also believed that Intel at the time looked down on foundry services.
I didn't expect that the giants who looked down on semiconductor manufacturing services back then would also start chipmaking (or foundry) today.
So, Zhang Zhongmou (Chong Mong Du) found it ironic that Intel entered the foundry business.
Now, TSMC's (Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company) market value has exceeded Intel's.
In the face of TSMC's strong offensive, Intel naturally does not dare to be complacent.
Currently, TSMC is racing towards 3nm chips, while Intel remains stuck at 14nm from 7 years ago.
To surpass others is not an easy task.

Mauritius and Other Countries Report First Cases of Omicron Variant Infections - Xinhua Net

Xinhua News Agency, Beijing, December 12th: Combined report from Xinhua News Agency's foreign correspondents: Mauritius, Cyprus, and Malawi have recently reported the first cases of infection with the new coronavirus variant, Omicron.
Mauritius reported its first two cases of the Omicron variant infection on December 10.

According to Health Minister Kalisha Jagutpal, one infected person is a tourist who arrived in Mauritius from South Africa on November 27; the other infected person is a local resident of Mauritius who came into contact with someone who had recently traveled to South Africa and tested positive on November 30.
After hospital isolation and treatment, the nucleic acid test results for these two infected individuals have both turned negative, and they have now returned to their respective residences.
The Cypriot Health Ministry announced on the 10th that Cyprus has confirmed its first three cases of infection with the Omicron coronavirus strain.
These three people are all students who recently traveled back from overseas at the beginning of this month. They all had mild symptoms but did not receive inpatient hospital treatment.
To prevent the spread of the Omicron virus, the SAR government continues to strengthen its control measures.
From December 6 to January 10, passengers aged 12 or above who arrive by airplane and undergo quarantine must cover the cost of COVID-19 testing at the airport themselves.
China's National Health Commission announced on the 10th that it will begin administering Pfizer-BioNTech's COVID-19 vaccine to children aged 5 to 11 in the country.
Malawian Health Minister Khumbize Kandodo Chiponda announced on the 9th that Malawi has discovered its first three cases of infection with the Omicron variant.
The health department of the country conducted genome sequencing on 12 positive COVID-19 samples collected from November 9th to December 2nd and discovered these three cases.

"Stars Have a Rendezvous | Gemini to Experience Peak Meteor Shower on the 14th - Xinhua Net"

Xinhua News Agency, Tianjin, December 12th (Reporter Zhou Runjian): A space science popularization expert introduced that the Geminid meteor shower, one of the three largest meteor showers of the Northern Hemisphere and also the last large-scale meteor shower of this year, will reach its peak on December 14th. Friends who enjoy watching meteor showers can conduct observations in the second
Beijing amateur astronomers Anjiu captured the Geminid meteor shower in Qinghai on December 13, 2018.
Most meteor showers have their parent bodies as periodic comets, but the parent body of the Perseid meteor shower is asteroid 3200 Phaethon, which is an Apollo-type asteroid.
The Gemini meteor shower is currently the second known meteor shower not to be "nurtured" by a comet.

The Tianjin Astronomical Society's council member and astronomy popularizer, Xu Liupeng, introduced that just like a New Year's movie, the Geminid meteor shower will appear around the end of the year, with the "showtime" lasting from December 4 to 17.

This meteor shower is renowned for its high and stable rate, and is jointly referred to as one of the "Big Three" meteor showers of the Northern Hemisphere, along with the Quadrantids and the Geminids.

A notable feature of the Geminid meteor shower is that the meteor bodies move relatively slowly, with a rich array of colors and plenty of fireballs, making it suitable for both visual observation and for beginner astrophotography.
Tianjin resident Yang Jing captured the Geminid meteor shower in Jizhou, Tianjin on December 13, 2020.

The astronomy report shows that the Geminid meteor shower will reach its peak on December 14th around 3pm (UTC time). At its peak, the ZHR (the number of meteors that can be seen under ideal observing conditions, with the radiant point located directly above the observer's head, per hour) will be 150.
Gemini Meteor Shower Recommendation Index Chart.

Last year, the "Lyrid" meteor shower of the Gemini constellation left a deep impression on people, but this year's Gemini meteor shower will be affected by moonlight, resulting in a slight decrease in its brilliance.

The 14th day corresponds to the eleventh month of the lunar calendar, known as the "Yingtu" month. The bright moonlight can interfere with observations, but the good news is that the moon will set later in the night, and at the same time, the radiation point of the Perseid meteor shower will also rise higher.
Friends who enjoy watching shooting stars can conduct their observations during the few hours following midnight, when the moon has set, but be sure to keep warm and protect yourself from the cold.
How can one possibly observe more shooting stars?

"It is not recommended to conduct observations in the city. Instead, choose a location in the suburbs or countryside with high altitude, minimal light pollution, and an open view facing northeast. After waiting for the moon to descend, visual observation can then be carried out."

It is worth noting that the Geminid meteor shower has significant activity in all directions, so when observing, there is no need to constantly stare at the radiant point of the Geminid meteor shower.
For friends who like photography and want to shoot a dazzling "meteor shower" scene, it is best to choose a wide-angle, large aperture lens and shoot with high ISO and maximum aperture.

The market positioning of laser TVs and traditional TVs differs in that laser TVs are marketed as high-end, home theater solutions with larger screen sizes and better color reproduction, while traditional TVs are more versatile and come in a wider range of sizes and prices to suit various consumer needs and budgets.

In my understanding, the "traditional TV" referred to by the post owner probably refers to LCD TVs. The market positioning difference between laser TVs and LCD TVs mainly includes the following two points:
First, laser TVs are increasingly focusing on the large-screen market.

Compared to the market positioning of the fully developed liquid crystal television market, laser television is more focused on the large-screen market, or laser television is essentially a product created for large screens.

Currently, the mainstream size for liquid crystal televisions is between 55 to 65 inches, while laser televisions are generally 75 inches and above, with the largest exceeding 100 inches, fully meeting users' demand for large-screen televisions.
In recent years, the shipment volume and sales ratio of laser TVs have been continuously increasing globally, accounting for more than six percent of the total sales of TVs 80 inches and above.
According to Zhongyi Kang's prediction, the sales growth of the laser TV market in 2020 will exceed 140%, and the high-speed growth will continue.
The remarkable success of laser TVs in the large-screen market is mainly attributed to their exceptional performance in eye protection.

Based on the imaging principle of laser TV's diffuse reflection, the laser source's light does not directly enter the eyeball. Compared to the backlight source of a liquid crystal TV, the imaging process is closer to the natural condition of object imaging, and the stimulation to the eyes is also smaller.

"The SAIXI Lab of the China Electronics Technology Standardization Research Institute and ophthalmology experts from Peking Union Medical College Hospital compared laser TV and LCD TV under the same conditions in a strict test with 144 groups of test data."
Data confirms: Laser TV indeed has a strong eye protection feature and even has a certain improvement effect in specific aspects.

In an era where visual health is becoming increasingly valued, laser TVs have attracted a growing number of users with their eye protection advantages and opened up another breakthrough for the television market.
Secondly, laser TVs are increasingly focusing on the high-end market.

Despite the continuous decline in the price of liquid crystal televisions, the price of most laser televisions currently on the market is above ten thousand yuan. As the size and brightness source are upgraded, the price gradually increases.

Why are laser TVs so expensive?

Note: A laser TV is a type of television that uses laser technology to produce and display images.
That's certainly reasonable.
With the continuous development of lighting sources and technological levels, laser TVs have many advantages that liquid crystal TVs and projectors cannot achieve.

By leveraging ultra-short throw projection technology, laser TVs have a shorter projection distance compared to traditional projection devices, enabling a 100-inch screen experience in a small space, with a compact host that takes up minimal space.
When it comes to brightness, high-end laser TVs from major brands can reach above 2000 nits.
Adding to its lower heat output and reduced damage to equipment, televisions with this feature also have a longer lifespan.

Apart from that, many high-end laser TV models also feature true 4K ultra-high-definition quality, artificial intelligence systems, and biomimetic screens, among other cutting-edge technologies, providing users with a more stunning audio-visual experience.

This is not a matter of false demand, but rather a result of the subdivision of requirements. When it comes to image quality and cost-effectiveness, laser TVs are not suitable for audio-visual enthusiasts. If you want to balance a large screen and viewing environment, you can consider trying it. Every choice has its advantages and disadvantages, so weigh them carefully and make your own judgment, just be wary of relying on one-sided information.

Simply put, a super wide-angle short-throw projector, also known as laser TV, requires the use of expensive super wide-angle lenses and reflective mirrors to get close to the screen, which does not align with optimal optical design.
To block out certain environmental light, a microstructured Fresnel screen is used, but it comes at a high cost, with an 80-inch version priced similarly to a 65-inch liquid crystal display.

Additionally, I really dislike projector manufacturers advertising that diffuse reflection is good for the eyes. Come on, the light projected on the screen that the eyes can see is still direct light, even if you diffuse it onto the ceiling, your eyes still can't see it. Even with a liquid crystal television, it's still "directly" reflected, and doesn't the ceiling get illuminated when you turn on the TV?
Moreover, the projection screen will not look realistic if it is not matte.
The discomfort actually comes from the hotspots caused by the high-gain backdrop being overlooked, with a large amount of light reflecting into the eyes at a certain angle.

Is it reliable to buy insurance for an umbrella on a rainy day?
"Xiaoyu Umbrella is an internet-based insurance brokerage platform."

According to the "Administrative Measures for Insurance Intermediary Institutions (2015 Revision)," to become an insurance brokerage company, three key requirements must be met: the shareholders and sponsors must have no major legal violations in the past three years, the minimum capital must be RMB 50 million, and the company must be approved by the China Insurance Regulatory Commission.

These three requirements are quite strict, and can be summarized as follows: having actual strength, obtaining approval from the China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission (the national authority that oversees insurance companies and banks), and having stockholders with good conduct. As a small umbrella insurance company, there is no need for those who purchase insurance to doubt the legitimacy of small umbrella insurance, as not every insurance company can meet these three thresholds.
In this regard, it's not bad, it's reliable.

When it comes to insurance products, Little Umbrella Insurance is like an insurance supermarket, where many companies' star critical illness policies are sold, such as the recently launched Anda Super Mary No. 5 Critical Illness Insurance, with both the claim handling and underwriting being handled by Anda Life Insurance. Little Umbrella Insurance is just a third-party intermediary, so there is no need to question its reliability.

Based on the payment model: Internet platform products, due to the absence of operational expenses for business outlets and employee wages, generally have a higher value-to-price ratio compared to traditional products. Additionally, the payment method is flexible, supporting monthly payments, which alleviates the policyholder's burden of payment, and can maximize the leverage of insurance to the greatest extent.
This is still quite good.
It can be considered.

When it comes to the professionalism of sales staff, this is especially important because the insurance industry has a very high requirement for professionalism. Many internet product customers can self-insure, which will result in many misunderstandings, particularly in health disclosure and occupation. Non-insurance professionals tend to add their own subjective consciousness when applying for insurance, believing that they are healthy or suitable, which can easily lead to claim risks and the potential for claim denial.

I myself have worked as an insurance telephone salesperson at "Tencent Wei Bao" (which is similar to "Ele.me" and is an internet insurance brokerage platform), and I can responsibly tell everyone that.

Note: "Ele.me" is a popular food delivery platform in China, and the comparison is made to help readers better understand the nature of "Tencent Wei Bao".
Internet insurance is real and reliable, but the unreliability comes from people. The internet channel lacks professional practitioners and is prone to sales misdirection.

For example, an insurance policy that costs 1 yuan and provides coverage of 60 million, with a free phone offered upon purchase and 6 million in critical illness coverage given for free, are all effective marketing strategies. However, they avoid the main issue and fail to inform the policyholder that the first month is 1 yuan, but the following months require regular fees, ranging from dozens to 200 yuan. Many customers who have been charged for a year or two
The assumption that an insurance company will pay out 6 million for just $1 premium (an unbelievable windfall).

Free mobile phones are given only for special policy numbers ending in certain sequences, such as 6666 or 8888. If a winning message is sent out and the winner does not redeem it or is not reminded by anyone, the prize will not be claimed.

(For the policyholder, this is another pitfall.) Getting 600,000 critical illness coverage for free is only temporary. If there is no other commercial insurance, what good is 600,000 if a critical illness actually occurs? It won't solve the problem, and your future life will be uninsured.
Currently, the government is strictly cracking down on deceptive practices in online insurance sales.
Therefore, overall, there is no issue with the platform or the product. The problem lies in the professionalism and professional ethics of the sales staff.

I suggest that the original poster consider and carefully evaluate their options. In reality, many offline insurance agency companies offer a wider range of products, providing customers with more choices and often better value for money than internet products.
I have personally assisted 59 internet customers in underwriting offline products, with annual premium savings of 2000-3000 RMB per person.
If you have any questions, please feel free to communicate and share with me.

I am a Mingyi Insurance broker, with 3 years of corporate management training experience, having served nearly a thousand enterprise users and cooperated with over 100 insurance companies. Before underwriting, I start with the customer's needs and customize insurance products for the customer. During underwriting, I compare prices from three companies to strive for the best underwriting results for the customer. After underwriting, I help the customer organize policies, manage policies, and ensure that
Grow together with every customer for a lifetime.
I hope my answer is helpful to the questioner!

According to the definition of the insurance regulatory department, internet insurance refers to insurance business in which the policyholder can independently complete the entire insurance process by clicking on the insurance link.
During this process, the policyholder does not need to sign, and the insurance advisor also does not need to sign. All steps can be completed independently by the policyholder.

Although there is not much "ceremony" in purchasing insurance online, and there may not even be a printed physical contract, this in no way affects the legal validity and effectiveness of the electronic contract.
This pattern is somewhat similar to the "telephone sales" type of assembly line work, but purchasing insurance in this way also has a fatal flaw: subsequent service may not be able to keep up.

When buying insurance, which often involves a long-term contract spanning several decades, should we not carefully consider whether the "intermediary" we choose is one who can accompany us for the long term and continue to provide us with service many years later?

"VietnamPlus - Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh Attends the Third National Digital Technology Enterprise Development Forum"

Two main conferences were held during the Third National Digital Technology Enterprise Development Forum, focusing on the themes of digital technology enterprises and national digital transformation, as well as digital technology enterprises and economic recovery and development in the post-epidemic and epidemic situation.

The Minister of the Department of Communications and Media, Ruan Mengxiong, stated that in 2021, despite the continued spread of the COVID-19 pandemic, the number and business revenue of Vietnamese digital technology companies still maintained a growth trend of nearly 10%.

In 2021, typical digital products in Vietnam have increased, addressing the country's major challenges, with many digital products breaking out of the country, and Vietnam's ranking in digital technology has risen.

Minister Ruan Mengxiong urged digital technology companies to take on the responsibility of developing the national digital transformation platform and to view the task of developing these national digital platforms as fulfilling a national mission.

At the forum, leaders of various departments and national agencies that are engaged in researching, developing, applying, and transferring digital technology shared their visions and solutions for mobilizing and gathering resources from across society to develop Vietnamese tech enterprises and jointly drive the country's digital transformation, as well as breakthrough ideas and solutions for post-pandemic economic recovery.
Premier Li Keqiang emphasized during his speech at the forum that digital transformation is the inevitable path for the world, and it is the objective requirement for development.
Digital transformation has become a global issue, and digital transformation services the whole population, therefore it is necessary to mobilize the participation of everyone.
The people and enterprises are the core, main body, target, and driving force of digital transformation.
Therefore, all policies should be for the people and businesses.

Prime Minister Fan Mingzheng emphasized that digital transformation should reflect the national spirit, with a main focus on internal strength, strategic, long-term, and decisive factors, while external strength is an important and breakthrough aspect.

He believes that digital transformation should drive both in-depth and sustainable development, participate in the control of the COVID-19 pandemic, economic recovery and development, addressing subsequent changes, overcoming the phenomenon of resource depletion, and supporting the transition to green development and the development of green energy.

The digital transformation should involve participating in and promoting the establishment of databases related to national cultural values, historical traditions, and national customs and habits, and drive the digital transformation in fields such as banking, taxation, land management and development, and logistics.
The main goal of digital transformation is to make people happier and the nation increasingly prosperous and developed.

Premier Li Keqiang urges governments at all levels, departments, and enterprises to increase their leadership and guidance in developing digital technology, enhance their understanding of digital transformation, continue to formulate and improve systems related to digital transformation, strengthen national management, and actively and proactively promote the development of digital technology enterprises in terms of respect, communication, and listening.

During the forum period, Prime Minister Phan Minh Chinh attended the Award Ceremony of Excellent Digital Products of "Made in Vietnam" 2021 and the Opening Ceremony of the "Made in Vietnam" Digital Product Exhibition.

My friends and I were discussing Meta's recent drop of 26%, with a market value evaporation of 2510 billion US dollars. Zuckerberg responded by saying that they are facing unprecedented competition. But why is that?
Meta (formerly Facebook) is essentially an advertising company, with the majority of its revenue coming from advertising. As a profitable ad company, it has its own traffic channels.
Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and others, regardless of their specific positioning, are all traffic channels for Meta.
Not only that, but Meta is also the largest "ad alliance." Many apps integrate Meta's ads and monetize through Meta's advertising platform.
However, times have changed.
Firstly, due to Apple's adjustments to its privacy policy, Meta is having difficulty obtaining users' data information, which has affected the efficiency of its ad placement.
Apple's current privacy policy is very user-friendly, clearly notifying users if an app intends to access their information, with most people normally responding by not allowing it.

If Google stabs again next, the impact on Meta's revenue will be even greater. (Note: I'm assuming "Google" and "Meta" are referring to their respective companies, Google LLC and Meta Platforms Inc., in this context.)
Secondly, the contribution of China to Meta's revenue growth has also weakened (the exact proportion of this factor is uncertain, but it does exist).
Contrary to popular belief, Meta does conduct business in China.
Every year, at least 10% of Meta's revenue comes from China, mainly contributed by companies in China that do business in the sea industry.
Meta's Hong Kong office has around a few hundred employees, and there are also several large agents in mainland China.
Chinese companies looking to expand their overseas market consider Meta (Facebook) an unavoidable advertising channel, with most of the money burned going to Meta.
Interestingly, now Byte's TT is one of Meta's main competitors, but Meta has earned a significant amount of money from Byte in the past two years.
Domestic agents are all helping ByteDance (TikTok's parent company) place ads at Meta (Facebook's parent company), and the performance of Meta's Greater China region is also quite good.
I haven't specifically looked into it recently, but it's certainly not going to be better than before.
The stage of Chinese companies burning money on a large scale overseas has passed.
Thirdly, the expansion of new traffic channels has not been successful.
Facebook is getting older, and new platforms including TT are no longer under Meta's control.
The biggest problem is not just a decline in income, but a lack of growth expectations.
The capital market does not only focus on current income, but more importantly, on how the future expectations look.
It is clearly evident that Meta's expectations are not enough.
To tell a new story to the market, Zuckerberg talked about the "metaverse."

The metaverse is certainly a direction for the future, but the timeline for its implementation is relatively long. This story is unlikely to be enough to sustain Meta's market value in the next two to three years.
Therefore, the next two years are likely to be a challenging period for Meta.

Don't be fooled by Facebook's current success; it earns between 1,000 billion and 2,000 billion US dollars in revenue each year, but in reality, Facebook's sense of crisis is extremely strong. When compared to other internet companies and high-tech firms, it has no secure "moat" to protect itself.

Although his several social media apps currently have high daily activity and are mainstream, such as Facebook and WhatsApp, Facebook itself lacks confidence in facing TikTok's rapid development, and the overturning of the situation could happen in the blink of an eye.

As for the concept of the metaverse, which is highly desirable but difficult to achieve, there is no hope of success in the short term. Therefore, Facebook is in a very dangerous position, which is also the reason why Zuckerberg keeps changing the company's name and constantly searching for new paths. However, I think his choice of path is wrong and leads to a dead end. These are some of my thoughts, provided for reference.
Article 17: The state implements a registered practitioner system for registered fire engineering professionals.
Individuals who obtain a First-Class or Second-Class Registered Fire Engineer Certificate can practice as a Registered Fire Engineer at the corresponding level after registration.
Article 18: The Ministry of Public Security's Fire Department is the registration and approval authority for first-level registered fire engineering professionals.

The public security fire departments of provinces, autonomous regions, and directly governed municipalities are responsible for approving the registration of secondary-level registered fire engineers and conducting the preliminary review of the registration for primary-level registered fire engineers.

Article 19: Individuals who have obtained a First or Second Level Fire Engineering Professional Qualification Certificate and applied for registration shall be employed by a fire technology service institution or a key fire safety unit approved, and submit the registration application materials to the fire department of the local public security bureau (if the employing unit is an enterprise, it shall be submitted through the enterprise to the location of its business license registration) where the unit is located.

Article 20: Upon receiving a registration application from an applicant, the public security fire departments of provinces, autonomous regions, and directly governed cities shall notify the applicant of the complete content that needs to be corrected either immediately or within five working days if the application materials are incomplete or do not meet the legal requirements. Failure to notify within the prescribed time limit shall be deemed to have accepted the application from the day the application materials are received.
For both accepted and rejected registration applications, a written certificate stamped with the official fire department seal of the local public security bureau and dated should be issued.

Article 21: Public security fire departments of provinces, autonomous regions, and directly governed cities shall complete the preliminary review of the registration application materials for Level 1 Registered Fire Engineers and the registration approval of Level 2 Registered Fire Engineers within 20 working days from the date of accepting the registration application. The preliminary review results and application materials for Level 1 Registered Fire Engineers shall be reported to the Fire Bureau of the Ministry of Public Security for

The Ministry of Public Security Fire Department shall make a decision on whether to approve or not within 20 working days after receiving the application materials and preliminary review opinions submitted by the provincial public security firefighting agencies.
If a decision cannot be made within the specified time limit, the reason and extended time limit must be notified to the applicant.

For those who make a decision of non-approval, they shall provide written explanation of the reasons and notify the applicant of their legal right to apply for administrative reconsideration or to bring an administrative lawsuit in accordance with the law.

Article 22: The registration and approval department shall issue and deliver the corresponding level of registration certificate within 10 working days starting from the day it makes the approval decision.
Article 23: The validity period for each registration in a registered certificate is 3 years.

The registration certificate is the practicing license for registered fire engineering professionals of the corresponding level, which is kept and used by the registered fire engineering professional themselves during its validity period.
Article 24: Those who apply for initial registration must submit their application within one year of obtaining a first or second-level registration certificate for fire engineering.
If applying for initial registration after the deadline, the continuing education requirements specified in these regulations must be met.

The specific methods for initial registration, renewal of registration, alteration of registration, cancellation of registration, and non-registration, as well as other registration management matters, shall be separately prescribed by the Ministry of Public Security.
Article 25: Continuing education is a prerequisite for registered fire engineers to renew their registration, re-register, and for initial registration that has exceeded the deadline.
During the valid registration period, registered fire engineers at each level should complete the required continuing education as specified.

Article 26: The registration and approval department shall promptly make public the situation of registered fire engineer registration, establish a file of credible registered fire engineers, and implement credit management of their professional activities.

Article 27: The registration management departments for qualified fire engineering professionals at all levels shall strictly enforce the provisions of the Administrative License Law of the People's Republic of China.

"China and Vietnam's 'Peaceful Relief-2021' Military Logistics Joint Exercise Concludes Successfully - Xinhua News Agency"

Xinhua News Agency, Hanoi, December 12th: The Chinese delegation participating in the "Peaceful Rescue-2021" joint exercise between the Chinese and Vietnamese militaries safely returned to the Chinese border in Guangxi on the morning of the 12th, indicating that the training task, which lasted for 7 days, was successfully completed.

During this joint exercise, the Chinese and Vietnamese militaries focused on the major topic of humanitarian medical rescue, closely adhering to the mission of providing medical support, aiding the wounded, and saving lives. They completed the contents of joint command over medical care, joint on-site rescue, and mass casualty handling, effectively enhancing the ability of medical support for both militaries.
The exercise results were affirmed by both Chinese and Vietnamese military forces.

Ruan XiongshENG, director of the Exercise Steering Committee and Deputy Chief of Staff and Chief of Logistics of the Vietnam People's Army, said at the closing ceremony, "Through this exercise, the Vietnamese military medical personnel have learned knowledge about organizing exercises and professional activities from their Chinese counterparts, and have also witnessed China's medical and support equipment."
The achievements gained in the exercise have proven the professional capabilities of the two countries' military medical forces in medical assistance and epidemic prevention and control.

The head of the Chinese guiding coordination group, Deputy Director of the Health Department of the Central Military Commission's Logistic Support Department, Chen Chunming, stated that this exercise is another breakthrough and innovative practice built upon the successful hosting of the joint medical service activity in 2018, and it holds extremely significant milestone meaning.

During the exercise, the Chinese People's Liberation Army donated medical masks, protective suits, and rapid nucleic acid testing instruments to the Vietnamese People's Army for health and epidemic prevention.
